canonical_explanation.text: Water is very important for all living things. People, animals, and plants all need water to live. We use water every day for drinking, cooking, bathing, washing clothes, cleaning the house, and watering plants. Water comes from many places: rain gives us water, rivers and lakes have water, wells have water under the ground, and taps bring water to our homes. We must save water and not waste it. We should turn off the tap when not using it, not play with water pipes, and collect rainwater. It is very important to drink clean water. Dirty water has germs that can make us sick. We should always drink clean, boiled, or filtered water.
rules: All living things need water to survive.
We use water for drinking, cooking, bathing, washing, cleaning, and watering plants.
Water comes from rain, rivers, lakes, ponds, wells, and taps.
We must save water and not waste it.
Turn off the tap when not using water.
Always drink clean water. Dirty water can make us sick.

questions.question_text: All living things need ___ to survive.
questions.explanation_correct: All living things need water to survive. People, animals, and plants cannot live without water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Living things do not need toys, books, or pencils to survive. They need water to stay alive and healthy.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a use of water?
questions.explanation_correct: Cooking is a use of water. We use water to cook rice, dal, vegetables, and many other foods.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Writing, drawing, and sleeping do not need water. Cooking is one of the many things we use water for every day.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a source of water?
questions.explanation_correct: A river is a source of water. Rivers carry a lot of water and many people and animals depend on rivers for water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Books, chairs, and pencils do not give us water. Rivers, wells, lakes, and rain are sources of water.

questions.question_text: How can we save water at home?

options.text: Turn off the tap when not in use

questions.explanation_correct: We can save water by turning off the tap when we are not using it. Every drop of water counts!
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaving the tap running, playing with water, and pouring water on the floor all waste water. We should always turn off the tap.

questions.question_text: Drinking dirty water can make us:
questions.explanation_correct: Drinking dirty water can make us sick. Dirty water has germs in it that can give us a tummy ache and other illnesses.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water does not make us strong, happy, or tall. It makes us sick because it has germs in it.

questions.question_text: We use water to:
questions.explanation_correct: We use water to bathe and stay clean. Taking a bath with water washes away dirt and germs from our body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not need water to read, ride a bicycle, or play cricket. Bathing is one important use of water.

questions.question_text: Rain comes from:
questions.explanation_correct: Rain comes from clouds in the sky. When clouds become heavy with water, the water falls down as rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain does not come from trees, mountains, or houses. It falls from the clouds in the sky.

questions.question_text: We should always drink ___ water.
questions.explanation_correct: We should always drink clean water. Clean water does not have germs and keeps us healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should never drink dirty, muddy, or coloured water. Only clean water is safe to drink.

questions.question_text: Where does the water in our taps come from?
questions.explanation_correct: The water in our taps comes from rivers, wells, or big water tanks called reservoirs. It is cleaned and sent to our homes through pipes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tap water does not come from shops or books. It comes from rivers, wells, or reservoirs and reaches our homes through pipes.

questions.question_text: We use water to wash our:
questions.explanation_correct: We use water to wash our clothes. Water helps remove dirt and stains from clothes and makes them clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We usually do not wash pencils or books with water. We use water to wash clothes, dishes, vegetables, and ourselves.

questions.question_text: A well is dug in the ground to get:
questions.explanation_correct: A well is dug in the ground to get water. There is water under the ground, and a well lets us bring it up to use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wells are not for stones, food, or toys. They are dug in the ground to reach the water that is below the surface.

questions.question_text: Farmers use water to:
questions.explanation_correct: Farmers use water to water their crops. Plants like rice, wheat, and vegetables need a lot of water to grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Farmers do not use water to paint houses, build roads, or fly kites. They use water to grow crops like rice and wheat.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a source of water?
questions.explanation_correct: A table is not a source of water. Tables are furniture. Rain, rivers, and wells are all sources of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain, rivers, and wells all give us water. A table is a piece of furniture and does not give us water.

questions.question_text: Plants need water to:
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need water to grow and stay alive. Without water, plants will dry up and die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants cannot sing, run, or play. They need water to survive, make food, and grow tall and healthy.

questions.question_text: A lake is a large body of:
questions.explanation_correct: A lake is a large body of water. Many animals and birds come to lakes to drink water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A lake is not made of sand, mud, or rocks. It is a big area filled with water.

questions.question_text: Why should we not waste water?

options.text: Because we have too much water
Because water is precious and we may run out

questions.explanation_correct: We should not waste water because it is precious. There is only a limited amount of clean water, and we need to save it for everyone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not unlimited. Clean water can run out if we waste it. That is why we must save every drop.

questions.question_text: We use water for drinking and:
questions.explanation_correct: We use water for drinking and cooking. We need water to make food like rice, dal, soup, and tea.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not need water for flying, reading, or singing. Cooking is another important daily use of water.

questions.question_text: What is in dirty water that makes us sick?
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty water has germs in it. Germs are tiny living things we cannot see. They can cause stomach pain and make us very sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water does not have sugar, vitamins, or honey. It has germs that are harmful and can make us ill.

questions.question_text: A pond is a ___ body of water.
questions.explanation_correct: A pond is a small body of water. It is smaller than a lake. Many frogs, fish, and ducks live in ponds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pond is not very large, frozen, or empty. It is a small body of still water where many animals live.

questions.question_text: Neha left the tap running while brushing her teeth. What should she do?

options.text: Keep the tap running, it does not matter
Turn off the tap to save water
Let the water flow on the floor

questions.explanation_correct: Neha should turn off the tap to save water. We should only use the water we need and not let it flow waste.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Leaving the tap running wastes a lot of water. She should turn it off while brushing and turn it on only to rinse.

questions.question_text: It has not rained for many months. The village well is almost dry. Why?

options.text: Because wells do not need rain
Because rain fills up the water under the ground
Because the well is too big

questions.explanation_correct: When it does not rain, the water under the ground is not filled up. Wells get water from underground. No rain means less water in wells.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain is very important because it fills up the water under the ground. When there is no rain, wells can dry up.

questions.question_text: Ramesh saw children playing with a water pipe on the road. What is wrong?

options.text: Nothing is wrong, water is for playing
They are wasting water that others need

questions.explanation_correct: The children are wasting water. Water is precious and should not be used for playing. Other people and animals need that water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water pipes are not toys. Playing with water wastes it. Many people do not have enough water to drink, so we should save it.

questions.question_text: Why do we boil water before drinking in some places?

options.text: To kill germs and make it safe

questions.explanation_correct: We boil water to kill the germs in it. Boiling makes the water safe to drink because the heat destroys the germs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We do not boil water just to make it hot or waste gas. We boil it to kill germs so it becomes safe to drink.

questions.question_text: Priya's mother uses water from the tap to cook and wash dishes. This shows that we use water for:

options.text: Many things like cooking and cleaning

questions.explanation_correct: We use water for many things every day, like cooking, washing dishes, bathing, cleaning, and drinking. Water is used for many tasks.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not just for drinking or playing. We use it for cooking, cleaning, washing, and many other important things.

questions.question_text: During summer, many areas do not get enough water. What should we do?

options.text: Save water and use only what we need

questions.explanation_correct: During summer, we should save water and use only what we need. We can reuse water and turn off taps to save water for everyone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Using more water or leaving taps open would make the problem worse. We should save water, especially in summer.

questions.question_text: A fish lives in water. If we take a fish out of water, it will:

options.text: Not survive because it needs water to live

questions.explanation_correct: A fish cannot survive without water. Fish breathe through water and need it to live. Without water, a fish will die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish cannot fly or turn into birds. They need water to breathe and live. Taking a fish out of water is very harmful to it.

questions.question_text: Sita collects rainwater in a bucket. She uses it to water her plants. What is she doing?
questions.explanation_correct: Sita is saving water by collecting rainwater and using it for her plants. This is a very good way to reuse water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Collecting and using rainwater is saving water, not wasting it. Sita is being very smart by using rain for her plants.

questions.question_text: Water in a river is flowing, but water in a pond is still. Both are sources of:
questions.explanation_correct: Both rivers and ponds are sources of water. Rivers have flowing water and ponds have still water, but both have water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rivers and ponds are not sources of food, toys, or sand. They are both sources of water that animals and people can use.

questions.question_text: Anil saw green, smelly water in a ditch. Should he drink it?

options.text: Yes, it is green and good
No, it is dirty and has germs

questions.explanation_correct: Anil should NOT drink that water. Green, smelly water is very dirty and full of germs. It will make him very sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Green, smelly water is dirty and dangerous. It has germs that cause diseases. We should only drink clean, clear water.

questions.question_text: Which is the best way to save water while washing hands?

options.text: Keep the tap running the whole time
Turn off the tap while rubbing soap, turn on to rinse
Use a bucket full of water
Do not wash hands at all

questions.explanation_correct: The best way is to turn off the tap while rubbing soap and turn it on again only to rinse. This saves a lot of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping the tap running wastes water. Not washing hands is unhealthy. Turning the tap off while soaping saves the most water.

questions.question_text: In a village, people get water from a well. The well gets its water from:
questions.explanation_correct: Wells get water from under the ground. Rainwater goes into the soil and collects deep underground. Wells reach this water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Well water comes from underground, not from the sky, shops, or trees. When people dig a well, they reach the water stored below.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a way to save water?

options.text: Turn off the tap after use
Let the tap drip all night
Use a bucket instead of a hose

questions.explanation_correct: Letting the tap drip all night wastes water. The other options (turning off taps, collecting rain, using a bucket) all save water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Turning off taps, collecting rain, and using buckets all save water. Letting a tap drip wastes water all night.

questions.question_text: Name three uses of water.
questions.explanation_correct: Drinking, cooking, and bathing are three important uses of water. We need water for all three every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Reading, singing, and sleeping do not need water. Drinking, cooking, and bathing are the correct uses of water.

questions.question_text: Name three sources of water.
questions.explanation_correct: River, well, and rain are all sources of water. They give us the water we need for daily life.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tables, dogs, and pens are not sources of water. Rivers, wells, and rain give us water.

questions.question_text: What happens if we drink water from a dirty pond?

options.text: We may get diseases like diarrhoea

questions.explanation_correct: If we drink dirty pond water, we may get diseases like diarrhoea, vomiting, and stomach pain. Dirty water has harmful germs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water does not make us strong or tall. It has germs that cause diseases. We should always drink clean water.

questions.question_text: Raju uses a mug to take a bath instead of standing under a shower. Why is this better?

options.text: Using a mug saves more water than a shower

questions.explanation_correct: Using a mug and bucket saves more water than standing under a shower. A shower uses much more water in the same time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Both showers and mugs can clean you. But using a mug saves water because you use only what you need.

questions.question_text: Which of these living things does NOT need water?

options.text: None of the above - all need water

questions.explanation_correct: All living things need water. Plants, fish, and people all need water to survive. No living thing can live without water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Every living thing needs water. Plants drink water from soil. Fish live in water. People drink water every day.

questions.question_text: We use water for drinking.
questions.explanation_correct: We drink water every day to stay alive and healthy. Drinking water is one of the most important uses of water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Drinking water is very important. Our body needs water every day to work properly.

questions.question_text: A river is a source of water.
questions.explanation_correct: A river is a source of water. Rivers carry water from mountains to plains. Many cities and villages get water from rivers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Rivers are one of the biggest sources of water. People, animals, and farmers all use river water.

questions.question_text: We should waste water.
questions.explanation_correct: We should NOT waste water. Water is precious. We must save every drop and use only what we need.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Wasting water is wrong. Clean water is limited and many people do not have enough. We should always save water.

questions.question_text: Dirty water is safe to drink.
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty water is NOT safe to drink. It has germs that can make us very sick with stomach pain and diseases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water should never be drunk. It has harmful germs. We must always drink clean, filtered, or boiled water.

questions.question_text: Animals need water to live.
questions.explanation_correct: Animals need water to live, just like people and plants. All living things need water to survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Animals drink water every day. Without water, they would become weak and die.

questions.question_text: Collecting rainwater is a good way to save water.
questions.explanation_correct: Collecting rainwater is a very good way to save water. We can use collected rainwater for watering plants and cleaning.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Rainwater is free and clean. Collecting it helps us save the water from our taps and wells.

questions.question_text: Water comes only from taps.
questions.explanation_correct: Water does not come only from taps. Water also comes from rain, rivers, lakes, ponds, and wells. Taps are just one way water reaches us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taps are not the only source of water. Rain, rivers, wells, lakes, and ponds are all important sources of water.

questions.question_text: Boiling water helps kill germs.
questions.explanation_correct: Boiling water helps kill germs. When water is heated to boiling, the heat destroys the germs and makes the water safe to drink.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Boiling is a simple way to make water safe. The heat kills harmful germs that can make us sick.

questions.question_text: Plants can grow without water.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants cannot grow without water. They need water to make food, grow, and stay alive. A plant without water will dry up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants need water to survive. Without water, they will become dry and die. All plants need water to grow.

questions.question_text: A well gets water from under the ground.
questions.explanation_correct: A well is dug deep into the ground to reach the water stored below. Rainwater goes into the soil and collects underground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Wells are dug to reach underground water. This water seeps down from rain into the ground.

questions.question_text: Keeping the tap open while brushing teeth saves water.
questions.explanation_correct: Keeping the tap open while brushing teeth wastes water, not saves it. We should turn off the tap while brushing and turn it on only to rinse.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is false. An open tap while brushing wastes many litres of water. We should close the tap when we do not need water.

questions.question_text: Rain is a natural source of water.
questions.explanation_correct: Rain is a natural source of water. It falls from clouds and fills rivers, lakes, ponds, and underground water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Rain is nature's way of giving us water. It fills up all our water sources.

questions.question_text: We should always drink clean and safe water.
questions.explanation_correct: We should always drink clean and safe water. Clean water keeps us healthy. Dirty water has germs that make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Drinking clean water is very important for our health. We should never drink dirty or unclear water.
